producer.role: Supervision and review of metadata and documentation of study

prodStmt.fundAg: US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

serStmt.serInfo: This is the second GSHS conducted by Ghana.

stdyInfo.abstract: The GSHS is a school-based survey which uses a self-administered questionnaire to obtain data on young people's health behaviour and protective factors related to the leading causes of morbidity and mortality among children and adults worldwide.

sumDscr.geogCover: National coverage, junion high and senior high

stdyInfo.notes: The following core modules were included in the survey: alcohol use dietary behaviours drug use hygiene mental health physical activity protective factors sexual behaviours tobacco use violence and unintentional injury

dataColl.sampProc: The 2012 Ghana GSHS was a school-based survey of students in grades JHS 1-3 (Junior High) and grades SHS 1-4 (Senior High), which are typically attended by students aged 13-17 years. A two-stage cluster sample design was used to produce data representative of all students in grades JHS 1 -3 in Ghana Junior High and grades SHS 1-4 in Ghana Senior High. At the first stage, schools were selected with probability proportional to enrollment size. At the second stage, classes were randomly selected and all students in selected classes were eligible to participate.
dataColl.resInstru: The following core modules were included in the survey: alcohol use dietary behaviours drug use hygiene mental health physical activity protective factors sexual behaviours tobacco use violence and unintentional injury
dataColl.weight: The weighting formula used is: W=W1 * W2 * f1 * f2 * f3. The list below shows what each variable in the formula represents. W1 - The inverse of the probability of selecting each school W2 - The inverse of the probability of selecting each classroom f1 - A school-level non response adjustment factor f2 - A student-level non response adjustment factor calculated by classroom f3 - A post stratification adjustment factor calculated by sex within grade
dataColl.cleanOps: All data processing (scanning, cleaning, editing, and weighting) was conducted at the US Centers for Disease Control.

anlyInfo.respRate: Junior High: The school response rate was 100%, the student response rate was 82%, and the overall response rate was 82%. Senior High: The school response rate was 96%, the student response rate was 74%, and the overall response rate was 71%.

useStmt.citReq: Publications based on GSHS data should use the following acknowledgement: "This paper uses data from the Global School-Based Student Health Survey (GSHS). GSHS is supported by the World Health Organization and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention."
useStmt.conditions: The user undertakes: (1) to acknowledge the data source. (2) to share any planned publications with WHO prior to publication. (3) to offer co-authorship of any reports or publications using the survey results to the coordinator of the survey. (4) to use the data for non-commercial, not-for-profit public health purposes only.
useStmt.disclaimer: The data is being distributed without warranty of any kind. The responsibility for the use of the data lies with the user. In no event shall the World Health Organization be liable for damages arising from its use.

qstn.qstnLit: How old are you?
What is your sex?
In what grade/class/ standard are you? COUNTRY SPECIFIC RESPONSE OPTIONS

qstn.qstnLit: How tall are you without your shoes on? ON THE ANSWER SHEET, WRITE YOUR HEIGHT IN THE SHADED BOXES AT THE TOP OF THE GRID. THEN FILL IN THE OVAL BELOW EACH NUMBER.

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did you use soap when washing your hands?

qstn.preQTxt: The next question asks about physical attacks. A physical attack occurs when one or more people hit or strike someone, or when one or more people hurt another person with a weapon (such as a stick, knife, or gun). It is not a physical attack when two students of about the same strength or power choose to fight each other.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you physically attacked?

var.name: Q16
var.labl: How many times in fight 12 mos

qstn.preQTxt: The next question asks about physical fights. A physical fight occurs when two students of about the same strength or power choose to fight each other.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you in a physical fight?

var.name: Q17
var.labl: How many times injured past 12 months

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you seriously injured?

var.name: Q18
var.labl: What was serious injury past 12 mo.

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, what was the most serious injury that happened to you?

catgry.labl: I had a cut or stab wound

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, what was the major cause of the most serious injury that happened to you?

catgry.labl: Something fell on me or hit me

var.name: Q20
var.labl: How many days bullied past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 2 questions ask about bullying. Bullying occurs when a student or group of students say or do bad and unpleasant things to another student. It is also bullying when a student is teased a lot in an unpleasant way or when a student is left out of things on purpose. It is not bullying when two students of about the same strength or power argue or fight or when teasing is done in a friendly and fun way.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on how many days were you bullied?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 2 questions ask about bullying. Bullying occurs when a student or group of students say or do bad and unpleasant things to another student. It is also bullying when a student is teased a lot in an unpleasant way or when a student is left out of things on purpose. It is not bullying when two students of about the same strength or power argue or fight or when teasing is done in a friendly and fun way.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how were you bullied most often?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how often have you felt lonely?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: How old were you when you had your first drink of alcohol other than a few sips?

var.name: Q35
var.labl: Days one drink or more past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on how many days did you have at least one drink containing alcohol?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on the days you drank alcohol, how many drinks did you usually drink per day?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how did you usually get the alcohol you drank? SELECT ONLY ONE RESPONSE.

catgry.labl: Did not drink in past 30 days
I gave someone money to buy
I got it from my friends
I got it from my family

qstn.preQTxt:
The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
Staggering when walking, not being able to speak right, and throwing up are some signs of being really drunk.
qstn.qstnLit: During your life, how many times did you drink so much alcohol that you were really drunk?

var.name: Q39
var.labl: Number of troubles as result of drinking

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During your life, how many times have you got into trouble with your family or friends, missed school, or got into fights, as a result of drinking alcohol?

var.name: Q49
var.labl: Days active 60 min plus past 7 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about physical activity. Physical activity is any activity that increases your heart rate and makes you breathe hard. Physical activity can be done in sports, playing with friends, or walking to school. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 7 days, on how many days were you physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? ADD UP ALL THE TIME YOU SPENT IN ANY KIND OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EACH DAY.

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about physical activity. Physical activity is any activity that increases your heart rate and makes you breathe hard. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 7 days, on how many days did you walk or ride a bicycle to or from school?

Physical activity can be done in sports, playing with friends, or walking to school. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.

qstn.qstnLit: How much time do you spend during a typical or usual day sitting and watching television, playing computer games, talking with friends, or doing other sitting activities, such as COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES?

var.labl: Miss school no permission past 30 days

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on how many days did you miss classes or school without permission?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your experiences at school and at home.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often were most of the students in your school kind and helpful?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your experiences at school and at home.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did your parents or guardians check to see if your homework was done?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your experiences at school and at home.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did your parents or guardians understand your problems and worries?

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did your parents or guardians go through your things without your approval?

Percentage of students who were physically attacked one or more times during the past 12 months

var.labl: Worry prevented sleep most time/always past 12 mos

Percentage of students who ever seriously considered attempting suicide during the past 12 months
Percentage of students who made a plan about how they would attempt suicide during the past 12 months
Percentage of students who actually attempted suicide one or more times during the past 12 months

Among students who ever smoked cigarettes, the percentage who first tried a cigarette before age 14 years
Percentage of students who smoked cigarettes on one or more days during the past 30 days

var.name: QN31

qstn.qstnLit: Among students who smoked cigarettes during the past 12 months, the percentage who tried to stop smoking cigarettes during the past 12 months

var.name: QN32
var.labl: Others present smoking 1+ of past 7 days

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students who reported people smoked in their presence on one or more days during the past seven days
Percentage of students who had parents or guardians who used any form of tobacco
Among students who ever had a drink of alcohol (other than a few sips), the percentage who had their first drink of alcohol before age 14 years
Percentage of students who drank at least one drink containing alcohol on one or more of the past 30 days

var.name: QN36
var.labl: Of current drinkers, drank 2+ drinks/day 30 days

qstn.qstnLit: Among students who drank alcohol during the past 30 days, the percentage who usually drank two or more drinks per day on the days they drank alcohol

var.name: QN37
var.labl: Of current drinkers, got alcohol from friends

qstn.qstnLit: Among students who drank alcohol during the past 30 days, the percentage who usually got the alcohol they drank from their friends
Percentage of students who drank so much alcohol that they were really drunk one or more times during their life
Percentage of students who got into trouble with their family or friends, missed school, or got into fights one or more times during their life as a result of drinking alcohol
Among students who ever used drugs, the percentage who first used drugs before age 14 years
Percentage of students who used marijuana one or more times during their life
Percentage of students who used marijuana one or more times during the past 30 days
Percentage of students who used amphetamines or methamphetamines one or more times during their life
Percentage of students who ever had sexual intercourse
Among students who ever had sexual intercourse, the percentage who had sexual intercourse for the first time before age 14 years
Percentage of students who had sexual intercourse with two or more people during their life
Among students who ever had sexual intercourse, the percentage who used a condom the last time they had sexual intercourse

var.name: QN48
var.labl: Used birth control at last sex

qstn.qstnLit: Among students who ever had sexual intercourse, the percentage who used any other method of birth control the last time they had sexual intercourse

var.name: QN49
var.labl: Active 60+ mins/day for 5+ of past 7 days

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students who were physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day on five or more days during the past seven days

var.name: QN50
var.labl: Walk/Bike to/from school 0 of past 7 days

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students who did not walk or ride a bicycle to or from school during the past seven days
Percentage of students who went to physical education (PE) class on three or more days each week during this school year

var.name: QN52
var.labl: Sitting activities 3+ hours/day of usual day

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students who spent three or more hours per day during a typical or usual day doing sitting activities

var.name: QN53
var.labl: Miss school no permission 1+ of past 30 days

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students who missed classes or school without permission on one or more of the past 30 days
Percentage of students who reported most of the students in their school were kind and helpful most of the time or always during the past 30 days
Percentage of students whose parents or guardians checked to see if their homework was done most of the time or always during the past 30 days
Percentage of students whose parents or guardians understood their problems and worries most of the time or always during the past 30 days

var.name: QN57
var.labl: Parents most/always know about free time

qstn.qstnLit: Percentage of students whose parents or guardians really knew what they were doing with their free time most of the time or always during the past 30 days
Percentage of students whose parents or guardians went through their things without their approval never or rarely during the past 30 days
Percentage of students who were overweight (>+1SD from median for BMI by age and sex)
Percentage of students who were obese (>+2SD from median for BMI by age and sex)
Percentage of students who were underweight (<-2SD from median for BMI by age and sex)
Percentage of students who usually ate fruits and vegetables five or more times per day during the past 30 days
Percentage of students who used any tobacco on one or more days during the past 30 days
Percentage of students who were physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day on all seven days during the past seven days
Percentage of students who went to physical education (PE) class on five or more days each week during this school year
Among students who drank so much alcohol they were really drunk one or more times during their life, the percentage who had ever had sexual intercourse

Among students who most of the time or always had been so worried about something that they could not sleep at night during the past 12 months, the percentage who were bullied on one or more days during the past 30 days

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how many times per day did you usually drink carbonated soft drinks, such as COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES? (Do not include diet soft drinks.)

catgry.labl: Less than one time per day

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about what you might eat and drink
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 7 days, on how many days did you eat food from a fast food restaurant, such as COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about cleaning your teeth and washing your hands.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how many times per day did you usually clean or brush your teeth?

var.labl: Wash hands before eating past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about cleaning your teeth and washing your hands.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did you wash your hands before eating?

var.name: Q13
var.labl: Wash hands after toilet past 30 day

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about cleaning your teeth and washing your hands.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did you wash your hands after using the toilet or latrine?

var.name: Q14
var.labl: Used soap on hands past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about cleaning your teeth and washing your hands.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how often did you use soap when washing your hands?

qstn.preQTxt: The next question asks about physical attacks. A physical attack occurs when one or more people hit or strike someone, or when one or more people hurt another person with a weapon (such as a stick, knife, or gun). It is not a physical attack when two students of about the same strength or power choose to fight each other.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you physically attacked?

var.name: Q16
var.labl: How many times in fight 12 mos

qstn.preQTxt: The next question asks about physical fights. A physical fight occurs when two students of about the same strength or power choose to fight each other.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you in a physical fight?

var.name: Q17
var.labl: How many times injured past 12 months

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times were you seriously injured?

var.name: Q18
var.labl: What was serious injury past 12 mo.

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, what was the most serious injury that happened to you?

catgry.labl: I had a cut or stab wound

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about serious injuries that happened to you. An injury is serious when it makes you miss at least one full day of usual activities (such as school, sports, or a job) or requires treatment by a doctor or nurse.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, what was the major cause of the most serious injury that happened to you?

catgry.labl: Something fell on me or hit me

var.name: Q20
var.labl: How many days bullied past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 2 questions ask about bullying. Bullying occurs when a student or group of students say or do bad and unpleasant things to another student. It is also bullying when a student is teased a lot in an unpleasant way or when a student is left out of things on purpose. It is not bullying when two students of about the same strength or power argue or fight or when teasing is done in a friendly and fun way.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on how many days were you bullied?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 2 questions ask about bullying. Bullying occurs when a student or group of students say or do bad and unpleasant things to another student. It is also bullying when a student is teased a lot in an unpleasant way or when a student is left out of things on purpose. It is not bullying when two students of about the same strength or power argue or fight or when teasing is done in a friendly and fun way.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how were you bullied most often?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how often have you felt lonely?

var.name: Q23
var.labl: Times could not sleep past 12 mo.

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how often have you been so worried about something that you could not sleep at night?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, did you ever seriously consider attempting suicide?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, how many times did you actually attempt suicide?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about your feelings and friendships.
qstn.qstnLit: How many close friends do you have?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about cigarette and other tobacco use.

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 12 months, have you ever tried to stop smoking cigarettes?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about cigarette and other tobacco use.
qstn.qstnLit: Which of your parents or guardians use any form of tobacco?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: How old were you when you had your first drink of alcohol other than a few sips?

var.name: Q35
var.labl: Days one drink or more past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on how many days did you have at least one drink containing alcohol?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, on the days you drank alcohol, how many drinks did you usually drink per day?

catgry.labl: Did not drink in past 30 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how did you usually get the alcohol you drank? SELECT ONLY ONE RESPONSE.

catgry.labl: Did not drink in past 30 days
I gave someone money to buy
I got it from my friends
I got it from my family

qstn.preQTxt:
The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
Staggering when walking, not being able to speak right, and throwing up are some signs of being really drunk.
qstn.qstnLit: During your life, how many times did you drink so much alcohol that you were really drunk?

var.name: Q39
var.labl: Number of troubles as result of drinking

qstn.preQTxt: The next 6 questions ask about drinking alcohol. This includes drinking COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES. Drinking alcohol does not include drinking a few sips of wine for religious purposes. A "drink" is a glass of wine, a bottle of beer, a small glass of liquor, or a mixed drink.
qstn.qstnLit: During your life, how many times have you got into trouble with your family or friends, missed school, or got into fights, as a result of drinking alcohol?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about drug use. This includes using marijuana, amphetamines, cocaine, inhalants, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES
qstn.qstnLit: How old were you when you first used drugs?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 4 questions ask about drug use. This includes using marijuana, amphetamines, cocaine, inhalants, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES

qstn.qstnLit: During the past 30 days, how many times have you used marijuana (also called COUNTRY SPECIFIC SLANG TERMS FOR MARIJUANA)?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 5 questions ask about sexual intercourse.
qstn.qstnLit: Have you ever had sexual intercourse?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 5 questions ask about sexual intercourse.
qstn.qstnLit: How old were you when you had sexual intercourse for the first time?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 5 questions ask about sexual intercourse.
qstn.qstnLit: During your life, with how many people have you had sexual intercourse?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 5 questions ask about sexual intercourse.
qstn.qstnLit: The last time you had sexual intercourse, did you or your partner use a condom or [COUNTRY SPECIFIC SLANG TERM FOR CONDOM]?

qstn.preQTxt: The next 5 questions ask about sexual intercourse.
qstn.qstnLit: The last time you had sexual intercourse, did you or your partner use any other method of birth control, such as withdrawal, rhythm (safe time), birth control pills, or any other method to prevent pregnancy?

var.name: Q49
var.labl: Days active 60 min plus past 7 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about physical activity. Physical activity is any activity that increases your heart rate and makes you breathe hard. Physical activity can be done in sports, playing with friends, or walking to school. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 7 days, on how many days were you physically active for a total of at least 60 minutes per day? ADD UP ALL THE TIME YOU SPENT IN ANY KIND OF PHYSICAL ACTIVITY EACH DAY.

var.name: Q50
var.labl: Walk or bike to school past 7 days

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about physical activity. Physical activity is any activity that increases your heart rate and makes you breathe hard. Physical activity can be done in sports, playing with friends, or walking to school. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.
qstn.qstnLit: During the past 7 days, on how many days did you walk or ride a bicycle to or from school?

var.name: Q51
var.labl: Days went to PE each week

qstn.preQTxt: The next 3 questions ask about physical activity. Physical activity is any activity that increases your heart rate and makes you breathe hard. Physical activity can be done in sports, playing with friends, or walking to school. Some examples of physical activity are running, fast walking, biking, dancing, football, and COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES.
qstn.qstnLit: During this school year, on how many days did you go to physical education (PE) class each week?

qstn.qstnLit: How much time do you spend during a typical or usual day sitting and watching television, playing computer games, talking with friends, or doing other sitting activities, such as COUNTRY SPECIFIC EXAMPLES?

Percentage of students whose parents or guardians went through their things without their approval never or rarely during the past 30 days
Percentage of students who were overweight (>+1SD from median for BMI by age and sex)
